topics.body:
So apparently the Missouri teen that was shot *may* have been racially motivated.

The FBI is currently investigating the shooting in their own separate investigation and the amount of evidence that contradicts the police report is not looking good for the officer.  The forensic evidence contradicts him, the witnesses contradict him and everything except the police report contradicts him.  I'm not joking; literally the only thing that says it wasn't unprovoked was the police report.

The question is will the police officer merely get fired or will he face prison time?  It's a case of police officer's word vs forensics.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
